page.title: 03Turnditch Hedges + Fields
page.content: The pattern of the fields locally shows that they have been used for grazing and cultivation over a very long period of time. I have completed a survey of four hedgerows near to the school. Three could well be over 200 years old while the fourth is probably over 400 years old.I think that this last hedge was probably part of a wood once as there are bluebells and fern growing in the bottom of the hedgerow. I have identified these trees and shrubs in the hedgerows; { {ash, birch, blackthorn, buckthorn,crab {apple, elder,elm,hawthorn,hazel,holly, {lime, poplar, rose and sycamore. The predominant tree and shrub is the hawthorn. Most of the hedges have been layered (pleached) at some stage. Only in a very few cases has the hedgerow been replaced by fencing.
